page.title: 07Bring Back Chinese Classes.
page.content: In June our local newspaper carried an article about{Chinese teaching}at our school. Chinese is being dropped from the timetable at John Mason School because of staff cuts. The Headmaster hopes to win financial support and sponsorships which could mean Chinese being offered to senior pupils in all Abingdon schools. Mr. Owen, the Headmaster says in a letter to companies that 'John Mason has stood out as one of only two or three schools in Britain to teach Chinese, a language spoken by almost a quarter of the worlds population.' Until the decision was taken to phase out Chinese about 30 third-year pupils at the school were starting the subject. A dozen to 15 of those went on to take 'O' levels or C.S.E.s and a handful continued to study for 'A' levels.
